page.title: 03Tollerton Hall
page.content: {St. Hugh's College, Tollerton. The 120 acre estate, mostly under farming, was purchased for around Â£17,000 in 1946 by the Diocese, to become the College of St. Hugh - a junior seminary, preparing boys and young men for the Roman Catholic priesthood. The staff included priests, devoted Franciscan sisters and lately, sisters from the Holy Family of Nazareth Order, backed by lay staff. By the late 1960's the number of church students declined. Admitting Catholic lay boys with no particular vocation in mind, the college became a private school supplying one quarter of the diocesan priests. The number of pupils dropped to under 90, and in July 1985, it was decided to close the school after one more academic year.
